head.title: Cut Spent Stalks, Divide Moss Phlox

hedline.hl1: Cut Spent Stalks, Divide Moss Phlox

block.p: Cut spent flower stalks of plants like Pulmonaria and Brunnera down to basal foliage. Remove spent peony blooms, and fertilize with composted manure. Shear back by half moss phlox (Phlox subulata) and other perennials that open up in the center. Moss phlox and other vigorous growers like yarrow and Heuchera may need dividing every several years.
Continue to divide and transplant before hot weather sets in. Keep transplants and container plantings watered.

In vegetable beds, maintain even moisture to avoid bitterness in cucumbers and to prevent blossom end rot on tomatoes.
